markdownRemark.html:
I had a directory (/var/www) of source code which was php and other junk (jpg) files mixed together. I needed to extract and recreate the same directory structure for all the php, but leave out all the other files.

This is my kungfu - I especially like the second command, where you fork out a shell to do the copying, thus keeping your {} variable untouched.﻿

[sourcecode language=“bash”]find /var/www/ -name \*php\* |xargs —replace=@ dirname @ | sed -e ‘s@\(/var/www\)/*@@’ | xargs mkdir -p

find   /var/www/  -name \*php\* -exec sh -vc ’ cp -v {}   `echo {} |sed -e ‘s@/var/www/*@@’`’ \;[/sourcecode]
